title: Canute Curtis
text:
Canute J. Curtis (born August 4, 1974) is a former American college and professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for six seasons during the 1990s and early 2000s. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for <a href="West%20Virginia%20University">West Virginia University</a>, where he was a consensus <a href="All-American">All-American</a>. He was drafted in the <a href="1997%20NFL%20Draft">1997 NFL Draft</a>, and played professionally for the <a href="Cincinnati%20Bengals">Cincinnati Bengals</a>. Curtis is a former defensive line coach at <a href="Towson%20University">Towson University</a>.
Early years.
Curtis was born in <a href="Amityville%2C%20New%20York">Amityville, New York</a>. He attended Farmingdale High School in <a href="Farmingdale%2C%20New%20York">Farmingdale, New York</a>, where he played for the Farmingdale <a href="high%20school%20football">high school football</a> team.
College career.
Curtis attended West Virginia University, where he played for the <a href="West%20Virginia%20Mountaineers%20football">West Virginia Mountaineers football</a> team from 1993 to 1996. As a senior in 1996, Curtis led the nation's top-ranked defense by setting the Mountaineers' single-season record for quarterback sacks with 16.5, and also made 11 tackles for a loss. He totaled 67 tackles, forced two fumbles, and had an interception. Curtis was recognized as a consensus first-team All-American, and was named the <a href="Big%20East%20Conference%20%281979%E2%80%932013%29">Big East Conference</a> Defensive Player of the Year. He was also among the finalists for the <a href="Dick%20Butkus%20Award">Dick Butkus Award</a> for best college linebacker and for the <a href="Nagurski%20Award">Bronko Nagurski Award</a> for best college defensive player.
Curtis finished his career as WVU's all-time sack leader with 33.5 sacks.
He also became a member of <a href="Alpha%20Phi%20Alpha">Alpha Phi Alpha</a> fraternity.
Professional career.
The Cincinnati Bengals selected Curtis in the sixth round (176th pick overall) of the <a href="1997%20NFL%20Draft">1997 NFL Draft</a>, and he played for the Bengals from to . During his six-season pro career, he played in 70 regular season games, started 15 of them, and compiled 87 tackles.
